marquee.div: We are sorry to notify you today that Governor Reynolds announced that Iowa Schools will not reopen this school year. Stanton Community School District will continue to provide Voluntary Continuous Learning opportunities through May 22nd which is the last scheduled day for the 2019-2020 year.

div.p:
Date: April 17, 2020
To: Stanton Families
From: Stanton CSD
Re: School Closure
We are sorry to notify you today that Governor Reynolds announced that Iowa Schools will not reopen this school year. Stanton Community School District will continue to provide Voluntary Continuous Learning opportunities through May 22nd which is the last scheduled day for the 2019-2020 . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about School Closure Update April 17, 2020

div.p:
The Public Hearing for the proposed 2020-2021 Stanton School Budget was opened by President Brian Bates at 5:30 p.m. at the Stanton School High School Library, 605 Elliott Street, Stanton, Iowa. Superintendent Gute and Business Clerk Shirley Maxwell presented the proposed budget. The hearing was closed at 5:42 p.m.
The Stanton School District Board of Directors met at 5:43 p.m. on Monday, . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about APRIL 13, 2020, REGULAR BOARD MEETING MINUTES

div.p: Latest Update Click the link for the latest on Stanton Schools!

a.aria-label: Read more about Latest Update for Stanton Schools, 4-14-20

h3.a: Update on Stanton Schools Closure as of April 3rd!

div.p:
April 3, 2020
Dear Stanton School Community
Iowa Governor Kim Reynolds announced yesterday the recommendation that Iowa school districts extend the school closure through April 30th.
The Stanton Community School District will follow this recommendation, and I hope that we can re-open school on Friday, May 1, 2020.
Of course, we will need to be prepared to close for the remainder of the school year if that is . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Update on Stanton Schools Closure as of April 3rd!

div.p:
Stanton Community School District gained approval over the weekend from the USDA to provide lunches to our students for free.
We are planning to serve daily meals to ANYONE between the ages of 0-18 that can benefit from this service starting Tuesday, March 24, 2020.
Meals will be served as a drive-through service between the Viking Center and the School’s Kitchen Area at 11:00 a.m.-12:00 . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about Free Lunches Provided!

div.p: Stanton Community School is participating in the Summer Food Service Program. Meals will be provided to all children without charge and are the same for all children regardless of race, color, national origin, sex, age or disability, and there will be no discrimination in the course of the meal service. Meals will be provided, at a first come, first serve basis, at the sites and times as follows: . . .

a.aria-label: Read more about News Release Open Sites

div.em: Current conditions as of 19 Apr 12:35 pm CDT

td.span: Sunny, with a high near 59. North northeast wind 9 to 14 mph.

A 30 percent chance of showers, mainly after 3am. Partly cloudy, with a low around 38. North wind around 6 mph becoming light and variable. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.

A 40 percent chance of showers before 10am. Cloudy through mid morning, then gradual clearing, with a high near 66. Light southwest wind becoming west 11 to 16 mph in the morning. Winds could gust as high as 26 mph. New precipitation amounts of less than a tenth of an inch possible.

div.a: This institution is an equal opportunity provider.

div.center: The Stanton Community School District, in partnership with parents and community, is dedicated to providing the highest standard of education to ensure that all students acquire the knowledge necessary to learn, grow, and succeed.

It is the policy of the Stanton Community School District not to discriminate on the basis of race, color, national origin, sex, disability, religion, creed, age (for employment), marital status (for programs), sexual orientation, gender identity and socioeconomic status (for programs) in its educational programs and its employment practices. There is a grievance procedure for processing complaints of discrimination. If you have questions or a grievance related to this policy please contact Mrs. Sheila Mainquist, 605 Elliott St., Stanton, Iowa 51573, smainquist@stantonschools.com, (712) 829-2162.
